layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Pour out for others with no expectation of return.

questions.text: Using my physical strength to help others (lifting, carrying, building) even when tiring is ...

answers.4: common — I offer my strength freely
answers.2: limited — when it's not too much
answers.3: moderate — I help when I can

questions.text: Showing up bodily for people in need (physical presence, not just texts) is ...

answers.1: rare — I support from a distance

questions.text: Doing menial, unglamorous physical work to serve (cleaning, manual labor) is ...

answers.4: common — I do whatever needs doing
answers.3: acceptable — I do it when needed

questions.text: Giving physical energy to serve even when tired is ...
Having done hard, dirty, exhausting work for others (and considering it a privilege) is ...

answers.5: honored — serving this way is meaningful
answers.3: real — but it's not my preference
answers.1: rare — I avoid that kind of work
